ARABIC: وَيَقُولُونَ سُبْحَٰنَ رَبِّنَآ إِن كَانَ وَعْدُ رَبِّنَا لَمَفْعُولًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: saying, 'Glory be to our Lord! The promise of our Lord is truly fulfilled!' Weeping,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And say: "Glory be to our Lord. The promise of our Lord has indeed been fulfilled."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and say: "Glory be to our Lord. Surely the promise of our Lord was bound to be fulfilled."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: They say, "Our Lord is too Glorious to disregard His promise".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And they say, “Purity is to our Lord – indeed the promise of our Lord had to come true.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And they say: "Glory be to our Lord! Truly, the promise of our Lord must be fulfilled."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And they say: Glory be to our Lord! most surely the promise of our Lord was to be fulfilled.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and say, "Glory be to our Lord! Our Lord's promise is performed."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Saying: Glory to our Lord! Verily the promise of our Lord must be fulfilled.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and say, "Glory to our Lord! Our Lord's promise is bound to be fulfilled."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And they say: hallowed be our Lord! the promise of Our Lord was ever to have been fulfilled.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: and say, ‘‘Immaculate is our Lord! Indeed Our Lord’s promise is bound to be fulfilled.’’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And they say: 'Glory to our Lord! Truly has the promise of our Lord been fulfilled!'"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And they say: "Glory be to our Lord! Truly, the Promise of our Lord must be fulfilled."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: and say, "Exaltations be to our Lord! The promise of our Lord is done.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And they say, “Glory to our Lord. The promise of our Lord is fulfilled.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And they say, "Exalted is our Lord! Indeed, the promise of our Lord has been fulfilled."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [17:108] and say, “Glory be to our Lord, exalting Him above [the claim] that [His] promise [of sending a prophet] had not been fulfilled. Indeed (in, softened) Our Lord’s promise, of its [the Qur’ān’s] revelation and the sending of the Prophet (s), is bound to be fulfilled”.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Saying: Glory to our Lord!) they exonerate Allah from having a son or partner. (Verily the promise of our Lord) regarding the sending of Muhammad (pbuh) (must be fulfilled) is true and must happen.
